However, the Ardougne cloaks 3 and 4 still surpass it in stab attack and prayer bonuses, while the mythical cape surpasses it in crush attack.

SMW Subobject for NormalExamine: Whose idea was it to have a cape made of lava anyway?Is members only: trueIs variant of: Infernal capeUses infobox: ItemImage: File:Infernal cape.pngWeight: 1.814Value: 80000Version anchor: NormalRelease date: 1 June 2017Item ID: 21295

An infernal cape is a superior variant of the fire cape awarded for completing the Inferno. It has over twice as many offensive bonuses as the fire cape, along with unrivaled defensive bonuses. In terms of overall bonuses, it is the most powerful melee cape. However, the Ardougne cloaks 3 and 4 still surpass it in stab attack and prayer bonuses, while the mythical cape surpasses it in crush attack.

An infernal cape can be exchanged for a chance of obtaining the Jal-nib-rek pet by speaking to TzHaar-Ket-Keh. Like killing TzKal-Zuk, there is a 1/100 chance of obtaining the pet this way. If the player already has the pet, capes cannot be exchanged.

The infernal cape can be combined with the max cape to change its appearance by turning it into the infernal max cape.

As of 15 March 2022, there are 39,785 current members that have obtained an infernal cape.

If the player dies below level 20 Wilderness, it will remain in the player's inventory; however, the item will be unusable and must be repaired by using it on Perdu and paying him 75,000. If not protected when the player dies at level 20 wilderness or higher, the cape is converted into coins. Alternatively, a Trouver parchment and a payment of 500,000 coins can be given to Perdu in order to lock it (after which it gains the (l) suffix); this allows the item to be kept in death, unbroken, even if the player dies at level 20 Wilderness or higher.

This item can be stored in the cape rack of a costume room.

Tier Emotes STASH Location Items Cost

Trivia[edit | edit source]

Real life version of Infernal cape seen in The Inferno's behind-the-scenes video
  • The first player to obtain the cape was Woox, who claimed the cape two days after release.[1]
    • As the first player to complete the Inferno, he was awarded a real-life version of the infernal cape, as well as a RuneFest 2017 ticket with full-expenses paid travel and lifetime membership.[2]
  • The infernal cape and fire cape, along with their max cape variants, are the only capes to have an animated texture whilst wearing them.
  • As of 13 November 2020, 1,692 infernal capes have been removed from users who obtained an infernal cape illegitimately by having another person complete the Inferno for them.[3]

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Old School RuneScape's Twitter account. 3 June 2017. (Archived from the original on 29 May 2020.) Old School RuneScape: "A MASSIVE CONGRATULATIONS TO @WooxSolo FOR DEFEATING THE INFERNO! First in the world!"
  2. ↑ Mod Ronan. "The Inferno." June 1, 2017. Old School RuneScape Forums.
  3. ↑ Jagex. Mod Tyran's Twitter account. 13 November 2020. (Archived from the original on 13 November 2020.) Mod Tyran: "Happy Friday 13th, we're rolling out a further 260 offences for illegitimate Infernal Capes this week. That's 1,692 in total so far."

[[File:Infernal cape detail animated.gif|left]]
An '''infernal cape''' is a superior variant of the [[fire cape]] awarded for completing the [[Inferno]]. It has over twice as many offensive bonuses as the fire cape, along with unrivaled defensive bonuses. In terms of overall bonuses, it is the most powerful melee cape. However, the [[Ardougne cloak]]s [[Ardougne cloak 3|3]] and [[Ardougne cloak 4|4]] still surpass it in stab attack and prayer bonuses, while the [[mythical cape]] surpasses it in crush attack.

An infernal cape can be exchanged for a chance of obtaining the [[Jal-nib-rek]] pet by speaking to [[TzHaar-Ket-Keh]]. Like killing [[TzKal-Zuk]], there is a 1/100 chance of obtaining the pet this way. If the player already has the pet, capes cannot be exchanged.

The infernal cape can be combined with the [[max cape]] to change its appearance by turning it into the [[infernal max cape]].

As of 15 March 2022, there are '''39,785'''<!--page=1592--> current members that have obtained an infernal cape.

If the player dies below level 20 [[Wilderness]], it will remain in the player's inventory; however, the item will be unusable and must be repaired by using it on [[Perdu]] and paying him {{Coins|75000}}. If not protected when the player dies at level 20 wilderness or higher, the cape is converted into [[coins]]. Alternatively, a [[Trouver parchment]] and a payment of 500,000 coins can be given to [[Perdu]] in order to lock it (after which it gains the (l) suffix); this allows the item to be kept in death, unbroken, even if the player dies at level 20 Wilderness or higher.

==Trivia==
[[File:Infernal cape IRL.png|thumb|Real life version of Infernal cape seen in The Inferno's behind-the-scenes video]]
*The first player to obtain the cape was ''Woox'', who claimed the cape two days after release.{{CiteTwitter|author=Old School RuneScape|url=https://twitter.com/OldSchoolRS/status/870939670363996160|date=3 June 2017|archiveurl=https://archive.is/yhptC|archivedate=29 May 2020|quote=A MASSIVE CONGRATULATIONS TO @WooxSolo FOR DEFEATING THE INFERNO! First in the world!}}
**As the first player to complete the Inferno, he was awarded a real-life version of the infernal cape, as well as a [[rsw:RuneFest 2017|RuneFest 2017]] ticket with full-expenses paid travel and lifetime membership.{{CiteForum|author=Mod Ronan|url=http://services.runescape.com/m=news/the-inferno?oldschool=1|title=The Inferno|forum=Old School RuneScape|postdate=June 1, 2017}}
*The infernal cape and [[fire cape]], along with their max cape variants, are the only capes to have an animated texture whilst wearing them.
*As of [[13 November]] [[2020]], 1,692 infernal capes have been removed from users who obtained an infernal cape illegitimately by having another person complete the Inferno for them.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Tyran|url=https://twitter.com/JagexTyran/status/1327212531887329282|date=13 November 2020|archiveurl=https://archive.is/FUt7M|archivedate=13 November 2020|quote=Happy Friday 13th, we're rolling out a further 260 offences for illegitimate Infernal Capes this week. That's 1,692 in total so far.}}
